Target just rolled out a new mandatory happiness policy — employees must smile if you’re within 10 feet, and ask if you need help once you hit 4 feet. It’s called the “10-4 Program,” but it feels more like corporate hostage etiquette. Because nothing says “we’re struggling” like forcing your workers to act like Disney characters with name tags.

In this video, we dive into the Target Smile Mandate — where fake friendliness is now part of your job description, and “Minnesota Nice” becomes a KPI. From stock drops to smile
title: TARGET EMPLOYEES FORCED TO SMILE!
